attributes.action: Ensure Gibraltar and Falklands representation in a reformed House of Lords
attributes.background: Brexit is a chance to rebuild our democratic institutions. The current House of Lords is an anachronism. Any reform to make it a directly elected body should also include Gibraltar and the Falklands in the franchise, underlying a new commitment to democratic principles.

attributes.action: Abolish unfair 'blanket pet bans' for leaseholders
attributes.background:
Homeowners should have the right to keep pets in their property. Leasehold homes are increasing, yet blanket pet bans are hidden in T&Cs. 

Blanket pet bans should be made invalid on all leasehold houses/flats & replaced with a fairer system that requires freeholders to review cases individually.
attributes.additional_details:
An estimated 1 in 2 homes has pets & freeholders are forcing leaseholders to part with these beloved family members. In 2015 the RSPCA rescued 118994 animals & Dogs Trust revealed 5142 stray dogs were put down that year. Pet bans will only add to this. With leasehold becoming more common, it’s reasonable to request blanket pet bans be abolished. It’s unfair to deny homeowners their pet without proper review. 

It was also deemed unfair by the ‘Unfair Terms in Consumer Contracts Regulations 1999’

attributes.action: Scottish vote for independence! The Scottish government pays!
attributes.background: The Scottish government has had it's chance. The rest of the of the UK should not have to pay because the First Minister did not like the result of the first vote.

attributes.action: Make the BBC a Pay per view Channel and abolish the TV licence.
attributes.background: Why should we be obliged to pay a TV licence for the BBC when they abuse the money of it. If it is to watch all channels than the BBC should give a part to all of them! Make the BBC a pay per view channel and let people decide either or not they want to watch this channel and abolish the TV licence

attributes.action: capita to lose the contract for moving nhs records.
attributes.background: I suffer from MS and cannot be referred to a new MS nurse because my record have not reached my new GP after 3 months and some have to wait 6 months+, its not safe.

attributes.action: Make parental alienation a crime. As it is child abuse
attributes.background: Parental alienation destroys the life of children parents and anyone around it and costs millions in court and social services

attributes.action: Look into the spiralling costs of funerals.
attributes.background:
A certainty that we will all be faced with... only until it happens to a loved one how many of you have thought about the costs associated with a funeral? A basic funeral at today's price is roughly £3000 projected to rise up to £6000 by 2023*

*figures taken from one funeral director.
attributes.additional_details:
The above cost is bad enough but doesn't stop there as it doesn't include the following to name a few: Embalming, burial plot, memorial or headstone, flowers, catering/wake.

I recently lost my sister at the age of 32, taken early & wouldn't have put anything in place to cover the costs.  As a result at what is a very difficult time for all involved we had to cover the costs.

A stress that isn't needed at a time when grieving & an issue that people then want to put behind them.

attributes.action: Ban refugees entering Britain until we are out of the EU
attributes.background: We must stop anymore refugees arriving in Britain until we are out of the EU. And we can then control who comes with more secure checks in identities

attributes.action: Make physical education take place every day during school for one hour
attributes.background: In the UK Obesity is on the rise and its something that can be controlled.We the people of the UK need to take action and quickly.A majority of people do not take part in regular exercise each day.we require at least one hours exercise each day and may find it hard to make time for exercise daily
attributes.additional_details: Obesity has risen for men has risen from 22% up to 30% since the year 2000 that's over a quarter of the United Kingdom's male population that is obese

attributes.action: Increase funding for an EHCP to allow mainstream schools to get the correct help
attributes.background: I have been fighting for 3 years to get an EHCP for my child, he now has one but with very little funding so he is unable to get the right help at school. He is missing out on education at a very important stage of his life. This process is effecting hundreds of SEN children, it's not fair.

attributes.action: Change law to require LA's to provide 15 min free parking in all LA parking bays
attributes.background: Often drivers feel they have received a parking ticket for staying only a few seconds over their designated period. There a distrust between drivers and local authorities, drivers believing that they are being penalised by Councils raising parking fees to cover other council spending.
attributes.additional_details: In 2013 LAs made £635 million surplus from parking revenue.

attributes.action: Give the British public a referendum on cutting foreign aid. Give it to the NHS
attributes.background:
An overwhelming 78 per cent of voters want cuts to Britain’s wasteful £12.4 billion annual aid budget, and the money diverted to the Health Service instead. 
If a tenth of the aid budget was diverted to the NHS, the £1.24 billion would pay for around three million stays in a hospital bed.

attributes.action: Consider a vote of No Confidence in Jeremy Hunt, Secretary of state for Health
attributes.background: The Independent exposes the collusion of Jeremy Hunt,  Department of Health and the HEE  to impose junior doctor contracts. Health Education England is meant to be an INDEPENDENT body  responsible for the teaching and training of health care staff. Mr Hunt cannot be trusted with future of our NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
6th January 2017 article in the Independent 
Emails show Jeremy Hunt’s Department of Health 'colluded' with ‘independent’ body to impose junior doctor contracts
Emails seen by The Independent reveal collaboration with Health Education England, which provides NHS trusts with £3.65bn of funding every year

attributes.action: To invest money in local government so they can support homeless shelters.
attributes.background: We are a group of Year 10 students from Greenwood Academy in Birmingham studying GCSE Citizenship. For a campaign we feel in our local area that there is not enough support given to aid local government in building more homeless shelters and provide assistance to those who need it.

attributes.action: NHS Charges for non National insurance payers
attributes.background: This issue is important because the NHS needs help and people that do not pay into the national insurance program should be asked to pay for their treatment received, We as tax payers all have NI Numbers
attributes.additional_details: My suggestion is that when we are first seen in A&E we are asked for our NI card as proof that we are entitled to free treatment, If we cannot provide this then we are asked how we are going to pay either Credit card or insurance documents. Just like checking into a hotel the card is swiped at first contact. On completion of treatment the card on insurance company are charged at the going rate of charges, This will help prevent the strain on NHS resources, and bring us in line with other countries

attributes.action: Stop the College of Policing requiring Police to have a degree before joining.
attributes.background: The College of policing are requiring new officers to have a degree or a 3 year apprenticeship before joining. Currently there are around 38% of officers who have a degree. As a current special constable alot of the officers I serve with haven't got a degree and their policing skills are fantastic!

attributes.action: Make a law against Balloon and Chinese Lantern Releases.
attributes.background: Daily Balloon and Chinese Lantern Releases are taking place. More animals are dying because of this. Animals can mistake litter for its' food when it eats this litter, it clogs up its guts - eventually killing it. With this, more species of animals are dying. Plus, it pollutes our environment.
attributes.additional_details: Balloon and Chinese Lantern Releases usually take place, because of the start of a new life, or the end of a life. Instead of polluting our wildlife and environment, plant a tree. It is much cheaper, and will last a lot longer! A little plaque can be placed in front of it, to dedicate the memory of somebody, or a time/event. It is a lot cheaper, efficient and friendly (both socially and environmentally).

attributes.action: Urge UN deployment of observers for safe evacuation of civilians and rebels
attributes.background: The Syrian Regime has failed to allow safe passage for besieged civilians and rebels to leave Aleppo and has resumed shelling. Thousands risk being massacred. The UK Government must support and urge the UN to deploy International Observers to facilitate the evacuation of all civilians and rebels.
attributes.additional_details:
As of the 14th of December 2016, France's Foreign Minister has called for the deployment of UN observers, but this has not been raised to the UN, nor does it stipulate safety for all civilians and militants. 

"What France demands is the presence of observers of the United Nations on the ground to have a guarantee that the evacuation, which is a priority for the civilians, [takes place], but also so that militants are not massacred," (Jean-Marc Ayrault - quoted by Les Echos newspaper).

attributes.action: Compulsory cardiac screenings (once every 6 months) for those who do any sport.
attributes.background: Some people have have died whilst part taking in sports, such as Robin Chard aged 48 who died of cardiac arrest whilst cycling to raise money for a cancer charity.
attributes.additional_details: These are only a few examples listed, but if we had routine cardiac screenings these incidents would have been caught earlier and treatment would have been provided.

attributes.action: Put a max of £3000 per year for undergraduate courses at university
attributes.background: University students are currently paying £9000-£9250 per year to study at university; seeing as there are no more grants, this is EXTREMELY unaffordable. Many graduates still tend to remain unemployed with a £27000 debt on their mind. Therefore, the amount should be altered to £3000 per year.

attributes.action: Dedicate July 1st as a bank holiday in memory of princess Diana.
attributes.background: Princess Diana was a prominent member of British history and deserves to be remembered for her contributions to her charity work and her support of the International Campaign to ban landmines. This bank holiday could replace the Whitsun bank holiday.
attributes.additional_details: The Whitsun bank holiday has become outdated and lost its meaning to the general public. We propose that the Princess Diana bank holiday would be more suitable, as it's closer to the nations heart. Her continued support for Great Ormand Street and other charities has allowed her to become an iconic role model for younger generations to aspire to be like. July 1st marks her birthday and a bank holiday on this day would allow the British public to remember and celebrate her and her achievements.

attributes.action: Require that all single use drinks cups are 100% biodegradable.
attributes.background: Currently only around 1 in every 400 single use drinks cups, mainly used for takeaway coffee are recycled.  Many such cups end up littering our pavements, parks, beaches and rivers. It is time that all such cups should be 100% biodegradable to minimise their impact on the environment.

attributes.action: Restrict noise of fireworks at organised displays to a maximum of 120 decibels
attributes.background: Fireworks sold to members of the public are subject to a restriction of 120 decibels. I ask that all fireworks are subject to this restriction as those used at displays are becoming rediculously load causing terror and suffering to animals and young children

attributes.action: Introduce online cyber-security and forensics degree courses for UK residents.
attributes.background: I am requesting the UK Government to introduce affordable and highly rated cyber-security and forensic degree courses for people with hidden conditions and other people alike all over the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: This would fulfill the dreams for those wishing to pursue security degree courses. Most national cyber threats could be eliminated by simply introducing online degree course in conjunction with some of our reputed universities.

attributes.action: Make it an offence Not to have a 'Poo Bag' on them in a Public Area.
attributes.background: With a number of Dog Owners 'NOT' picking up their Dogs Fouling Footpaths, Common ground and All other Public places, something needs to be done, Owners when asked 'Must' produce a waste bag or face a Fine or Ticket, also it makes sense that these Bags are Biodegradable which is not the case now.
attributes.additional_details:
We walk our dog and see in just our small area Owners pretend to pick it up with no bag in their hands and walk off after looking around, children and adults walk on it, on footpaths around schools a large amount left, it creates a Health issue as well as a long term Environmental impact with some owners after picking it up throw the bag into an overgrown area with the bags not breaking down.

This needs to be included in the Dog act with the Police having a scanner for chips and other checks.

attributes.action: Investigate motor insurance policy pricing to ensure it is fair for everyone.
attributes.background: Motor insurance is a legal requirement and a social utility, but the transparency in policy pricing and post inception activities of insurers in recent years, is disadvantaging consumers and was not addressed in the Competitions and Markets Authority's investigate of 2013/14.
attributes.additional_details: The recent article from uSwitch.com, ( http://tinyurl.com/z2w83bh ), highlights that those seeking to save money by opting for third party only or third party fire and theft cover, are actually being charged more than for comprehensive cover. As motor insurance is a legal requirement, it is felt that insurance companies should be both transparent and accountable for their pricing structures, for such a economically vital, social utility as motor insurance, so that consumers are treated fairly.

attributes.action: I would like to start a Personal trainer section within the NHS.
attributes.background: I have suggestion to get a Personal trainer section within the NHS to help people stay fit and healthy and mobile in there later years. I understand the NHS is stretched but if we work on this know it could have benefits to the country in the next 30 years and hopefully reduce the NHS deficit.
attributes.additional_details: I am a believer as we get older lifestyles become more hectic people get more sicker need constant medical attention. If we can create a NHS-PT Department I believe we can get people healthier and happy. Which may help the NHS as regards to all types of things from surgery to dementia which is stretching are resources. Creating a better more positive future for this country. It would create jobs for all ages races and cultures who want to help to get people fit.

attributes.action: Provide a figure for the UK investments in EU government buildings and the EIF
attributes.background: Provide a total figure for the amount of money that has been invested in EU central government building and infrastructure along with a figure for our financial interest in the European Investment fund. Then explain how you intend to recover those financial assets for our benefit.

attributes.action: Make railcards free for 16-25 year olds.
attributes.background:
16 - 25 year olds often have the lowest incomes, and yet have the greatest need for travel.
- They are starting out in careers
- They are still in full or part time education
- They want to travel the country and have the flexibility to work and live where they want
attributes.additional_details:
- Currently rail cards cost £30. This cost would be scrapped, but 16 - 25 year olds would still benefit from 1/3 of rail fares.
- This would enable more people to be able to afford rail travel.

attributes.action: Make 'Up To' internet package speeds illegal.
attributes.background: 'Up To' internet speed packages plague the UK market and are used as an instant 'get out of jail free card' if the companies oversell or over promise on what customers are expecting. Customers are not able to accurately compare speeds and often receive much lower than is stated.
attributes.additional_details:
Internet packages are often sold as 'Up To' speeds. A package 'Up to 100MBps' may in fact regularly provide 8MBps (8% of the expected speed). The Government should either:
A) Require the speed received to be no less than 80% of the speed advertised, (example "100MBps", min acceptable 80MBps)
Or
B) Force companies to sell at the minimal acceptable speed, (example "From 80MBps").
If the speed paid for is not met for more than 1 hour the customer should not have to pay for that days costs.

attributes.action: Boycott trade with China until removal of the barbaric dog meat festival & trade
attributes.background: "The trade in dogs destined for human consumption throughout Asia, results in the suffering of tens of millions of dogs each year. All stages of the trade- sourcing, transport, sale and slaughter- result in unimaginable animal suffering" - change for animals.org

attributes.action: The immediate withdrawal of all subsidies to Scotland from UK public funds.
attributes.background: That Scotland be prepared for possible independence from the UK by the immediate withdrawal of all subsidies from public funds for the Public Sector expenditure in Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: Since the support for Scotland is at a similar level to the net contribution to the EU, this will prepare the UK for the fiscal benefit of leaving the EU.

attributes.action: Give pensioners with Annuities or annuity based products access to their cash.
attributes.background: This does not mean  creating a second hand market but where two parties agree ie the Provider and customer remove the unauthorised payment charge of 55% by a simple change in legislation .

attributes.action: Make family courts use beyond reasonable doubt instead of probabilities.
attributes.background: Family courts in the U.K. Use a system where they can take our children away from parents and families on the balance of probabilities, this petition is to change that to Beyond Reasonable Doubt to protect our human rights and keep loving families together.
attributes.additional_details: This happens all over the U.K

attributes.action: Fine parents who refuse to vaccinate children
attributes.background: Vaccines have been repeatedly proven effective. Parents who refuse them are costing the NHS money and endangering to lives of vulnerable people worldwide. If heavy fines were in place this would negate those loses and prevent people carelessly making that choice.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/vaccinations/Pages/benefits-and-risks.aspx

https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/hcp/conversations/downloads/talk-infants-color-office.pdf

attributes.action: Introduce and enforce a trade embargo on Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: Saudi Arabia have an appalling human rights record. Homosexual acts are punishable by death and women are treated legally as second class citizens. In addition to their medieval society, there is evidence that the Saudi regime funds Sunni terrorists organisations. We cannot do business with them.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/saudi-arabia/local-laws-and-customs
"The Saudi legal system differs in many ways from the UK. Suspects can be held without charge and are not always allowed quick access to legal representation. The Saudi authorities have detained witnesses and victims of crimes."
"It is illegal for women to drive."
"The public practice of any form of religion other than Islam is illegal"

attributes.action: Stop the formal testing of children at primary school in the UK.
attributes.background: Stop the UK Government from forcing primary schools to subject our young children to regular formal testing. It is no longer just SAT's in year 2 and 6. Children are now forced three times per academic year to go through week long tests carried out like formal exams with exam papers and time limits.
attributes.additional_details: There is no evidence that subjecting young children to these formal test situations improves academic achievement. There is however a lots of evidence that mental health issues, depression, stress and anxiety are increasing in our children and young people. There is also much evidence around the importance of play and physical exercise especially for primary age children. So why is the UK Government forcing schools to subject our children to these formal exam situations? Help protect childhood.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on a income tax increase to help support the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is suffering from both drastic under-funding and the ongoing failure of any political party to address this issue. We seemingly cannot leave a decision on the future of the NHS to politicians and must help them find the courage to do what is necessary.

attributes.action: Introduce routine drug & alcohol testing to all adults working with children.
attributes.background:
Parents we need to take control of what our children are exposed to.
We are asking all parents to stand up for our children, sign our petition & insist that anyone working with under age children including school teachers must have compulsory routine drug & alcohol tests.

attributes.action: Now is not the time to seek deeper US relations. Delay triggering Article 50.
attributes.background: The British people want greater control over immigration, but not come what may. Now is not time to seek deeper economic relations across the Atlantic if it means giving up who we are. We call on Parliament to take stock of the changed circumstances and to delay triggering Article 50.

attributes.action: Balance the petition system by allowing people to sign both for and against.
attributes.background:
I'm calling for the petition system to take both for and against votes while retaining the 100,000 signatures needed. 
This way overall public opinion will drive the need for a response or parliamentary debate. 
The current system does not give a voice to those people who agree with something.

attributes.action: Vote of no confidence in Theresa May as PM over withheld information on Trident
attributes.background: The Commons voted to renew the £2.9b/year Trident nuclear missile program. We, the taxpayers, respect the outcome of democracy. However, if Theresa May made clear that Trident had malfunctioned, the result of the vote may have changed. Impeach the PM for dishonesty and a disservice to the people.
attributes.additional_details:
https://youtu.be/0WlVMeIEYpk
The PM repeatedly avoided a clear question on this issue, providing no reassurance to the public or the Commons about the safety of Trident.
The Trident Comission estimates that £2.9 billion will be spent annually on Trident. If it is not in working order, it poses a massive risk to the world, as well as being a waste of taxpayers' money.

attributes.action: Debate the referendum results before the Article 50 vote
attributes.background: The margin was just over 1m of 33.5m voted/46.5m eligible; areas of high immigration voted remain; under 44 year olds voted remain (18-24: 73%, 25-34: 62; and 35-44 58%); Scotland and Northern Ireland voted remain.
attributes.additional_details: MPs need to uphold their duty to act in the interests of the nation as a whole  and claims of a 'decisive' vote are inaccurate

attributes.action: Incentivise employers to accept CVs over application forms
attributes.background: The government should be working to make getting a new job as fast and simple as possible, yet those seeking work have to fill out forms that outline the same information in slightly different formats over and over again. The government should incentivise streamlining the job application process.
attributes.additional_details:
It is deeply inefficient for employees to repeatedly redraft their contact details, educational qualifications, and job histories, during every single job application. 

It would radically increase labour market efficiency if companies accepted CVs containing general information, followed by more specific questions about the candidates aptitude for the advertised role.

Candidates could then apply for more jobs in less time, shrinking their level of requirement for tax funded welfare support.

attributes.action: Cease backing UN resolution outlawing Israel’s presence beyond 1967 borders
attributes.background: Britain's vote to outlaw Israel's presence beyond the 1967 borders is unacceptable and it is supporting a one-sided motion. We must stop putting pressure on Israel, and allow the Israelis and Palestinians to negotiate their positions. This is key to prevent negative effects of religion on Britain.

attributes.action: Cyclists should have legally registered identification plates on their cycles.
attributes.background: This is to enable identification of, and consequences for, cyclists who break road traffic laws and cause minor or major road incidents.
attributes.additional_details: There have been previous attempts to pass such laws but they have been generally tied in with the introduction of proposed insurance and road tax for cyclists.  Most cyclists, however, also own cars and so the concept of paying for road tax and insurance twice is an incredibly controversial one.  In order to keep this proposal straightforward, I am suggesting simply that cycle registration becomes compulsory in the same way car registration is, as a means of identification.

attributes.action: Open places for homeless and people alone to socialise
attributes.background: With Christmas day coming up many people will be spending it alone and walking into new year alone, this petition is to try and get the government to agree to try and fund places for people like this. As people of the community to volunteer to help give the homeless and others to not feel alone.
attributes.additional_details: This may not be an issue for the government to agree on but it could be possible for them to consider funding socialise centres! Yes we have many places for these people like "feed the homeless" but what about the people sat alone on Christmas Day with nobody, reminding themselves they are alone! By signing this it will show the government their funding would be useful and many people in the community would love the opportunity to volunteer. Thankyou for reading please sign! See what we can do.

attributes.action: Make the police non emergency number 101 a freephone number.
attributes.background: Currently the cost of calling 101 is 15p per call, yet the similar non emergency number of the NHS 111 is free, this needs to be resolved as most people in the UK use mobile phones and mostly on contracts where their minutes wouldn't cover the 15p charge to report a crime.

attributes.action: A life sentence to mean life imprisonment.
attributes.background: A life sentence handed out to criminals should mean they spend the rest of their life behind bars with no option for early release
attributes.additional_details: All too often we hear of people being sentenced for horrific crimes and murders and are told they've been given a 'life sentence ' of which they must serve a minimum of 4 years or something ridiculous like that. Life should mean life, to combat the response of "we don't have the money or the space" - in these cases bring back the death penalty for murderers and child abusers who show no remorse and stop imprisoning people for petty offences like 'possession of cannabis'

attributes.action: Abolish Income Tax
attributes.background:
Income tax in the UK was introduced in 1799 as a TEMPORARY measure to fund the Napoleonic wars which ended in 1815. Income tax was abolished in 1816. 
It was later reinstalled in 1842 due to there being a growing deficit.
attributes.additional_details:
In today's society absolutely everything is taxed. For many people in minimum wage jobs this makes day to day survival a struggle. By abolishing income tax this would give them an extra £60-£80 a month which would be put towards improving their quality of life.
Many people could use this money to feed/clothe/shelter their families and as stated EVERYTHING is taxed therefore is there any need for income tax for everyone to prosper?
